docs.lead_paragraph: Endorsements don’t work if they’re oblique and half-hearted, as if they had been sent via Candygram.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medical devices may seem an inviting target to better control Medicare spending, but plans for a health care overhaul do not address the quality or the cost of the products.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Democrats are bracing for a potential invasion of protesters in the Capitol complex on Thursday after Representative Michele Bachmann, Republican of Minnesota, urged opponents of the Democrats' health care legislation to come to Washington to make their voices heard. Ms. Bachmann, in an appearance on Fox television Tuesday morning, invited opponents of the health care bill to join her for a news conference at noon Thursday on the steps of the Capitol. And she urged them to visit the offices of individual lawmakers to tell them to vote against the bill.
docs.abstract: House Democrats brace for possible protests in Capitol complex in Washington (DC) after Republican Rep Michele Bachmann urges opponents of Democrats' health care legislation to come to Washington to make their voices heard; photo (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: William Hsiao is a professor of economics at the Harvard School of Public Health. He served as a health care adviser to the Taiwan government in the 1990s, when officials decided to revamp that country's health care system. Here is an excerpt of his conversation with the writer Anne Underwood. A fuller version appears on the Prescriptions blog. Q.What was Taiwan's health care system like before 1995?

headline.kicker: HOW THEY DO IT OVER THERE

docs.lead_paragraph: In times of economic hardship, small businesses are among the first to feel the effects. As income declines and costs for employee coverage rise, health insurance is often one of the first expenses to be cut. In an audio slideshow on the Prescriptions blog, a business owner, Zoraida Reyes, tells her story. Ms. Reyes, 48, owns a check-cashing business in Bridgeport, Conn. She has never been able to afford to offer health insurance to her few employees. Recently, she and her husband dropped their own insurance policy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Congressional Budget Office said on Wednesday that an alternative health care bill put forward by House Republicans would have little impact in extending health benefits to the roughly 30 million uninsured Americans, but would reduce average insurance premium costs for people who have coverage.

headline.main: Budget Monitor Says G.O.P. Bill Leaves Many Uninsured

docs.abstract: A Republican alternative to the Democrats' health care plan may have limited impact, a report finds.
docs.snippet: A Republican alternative to the Democrats' health care plan may have limited impact, a report finds.

docs.lead_paragraph: As we reported last night, Senator Tom Harkin's hearing in the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee on small-business insurance costs wasn't the only small-business game in Washington on Wednesday. The liberal Main Street Alliance, along with the Consumers Union, U.S. PIRG, and the Small Business Majority, sent 134 small-business owners from 26 states to Capitol Hill to mingle with legislators and the press.
docs.abstract: Groups favoring a public option as part of a health care reform plan sent 134 business owners to Washington to lobby their legislators. Some came away frustrated.
docs.snippet: Groups favoring a public option as part of a health care reform plan sent 134 business owners to Washington to lobby their legislators. Some came away frustrated.

docs.lead_paragraph: In promising that Democrats would soon finish their big health care legislation, Senator Tom Harkin has done everything but put on a Santa Claus costume.
docs.abstract: Senator Tom Harkin concedes that the health care timetable has slipped.
